results.title: Out here
results.creator_credit: Ross Landers and Warrnambool (Vic.). Early Childhood Development Complex
results.brief_description: Shows some of the services of the Early Childhood Development Complex, Warrnambool, which provides for children both normal and handicapped, who would otherwise suffer from isolation in Victoria’s south-west region. Services include loans of toys and books, a travelling medical service, a Family Day Care group, and a support group for handicapped children and their parents.

results.title: Out of bounds: Teenage sexual harassment
results.creator_credit: Donald R. Ham, Yvonne Harper and Coronet
results.brief_description: Aimed at teenagers this documentary explores what constitutes sexual harassment and what can be done to combat it. Sexual harassment is defined as unwanted tension of a sexual nature-attitude is portrayed as the biggest contributor. Issues such as what is defined as bad habits, whistling and joking etc and what to do if your the victim of sexual harassment are explored. The video also offers a solution to the problem- recognising that harassment has taken place and communication to recognise the boundaries of a relationship. The material is presented through a fictional case study which is narrated and commented on.

results.title: Out for a change: addressing homophobia in women's sports
results.brief_description: A documentary which addresses the issues of homophobia in women’s sports. In particular, homophobia is seen as a political tool which is used to control the lucrative sports industry. Interviews with aspiring young women athletes, coaches, administrators and professional athletes such as Zina Garrison-Jackson and Martina Navratilova offer a rare insight into the insidious nature of homophobia and how athletes can confront and deal with the problem.

results.title: Our water our future
results.creator_credit: Arron Wood, Katherine McIntosh, Seven Network Limited (Australia), Victoria. Dept. of Sustainability and Environment and Highland Productions
results.brief_description:
This documentary provides an entertaining, informative and educational insight into how Victoria’s homes, farms, environment and industries depend on a secure water supply. It explores the contrasts between rural and urban Victoria, demonstrating that water security is a statewide issue affecting everyone. Hosted by Arron Wood,
Environmental Scientist.

results.title: Our town
results.creator_credit: Sam Woods, Sol Lesser and Principal Artists
results.brief_description: Thorton Wilder’s Pulitzer Prize-winning play was adapted to the screen, bringing to life an array of wonderful characters played by an impressive cast. Set in Grover’s Corner, New Hampshire, the typical American small-town of the early 1900’s is vividly recreated. Frank Craven as the narrator takes us on a “peephole” tour where we are given a simple yet dramatic account of what goes on in the lives of people from childhood to courtship; from birth to death. A young William Holden and Martha Scott in her first screen appearance, are the focal characters. Sam Wood’s techniques: a series of dazzling dissolves, evocative lighting and effective montages capture the essence of the period, so much so, that “Our Town” has become a cinema classic to be treasured in the hearts of film lovers.

results.title: Dead heart
results.creator_credit: Nick Parsons, Helen Watts, Bryan Brown and Film Finance Corporation Australia
results.brief_description: Constable Ray Lorkin (Bryan Brown) struggles to maintain law and order in the Aboriginal community of Wala Wala. The geographical isolation of the community is heightened by the incompatability between “white man’s justice” and indigenous tribal law. The situation reaches crisis point when a young Aboriginal (Aaron Pedersen) allows the white woman with whom he is having an affair to view a sacred initiation site. “Dead Heart” presents an honest portrayal of the conflict between two cultures and laws and the consequences that can occur. Parsons also wrote the script.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Nick Parsons, Helen Watts, Bryan Brown and Film Finance Corporation Australia

results.title: De Mayerling a Sarajevo = from Mayerling to Sarajevo
results.brief_description:
Ophuls traces the fall of the Austro-Hungarian empire by spiritually linking the tragic 19th century romance of Crown Duke Rudolph and Baroness Maria Vetsera to the 1914 assassination of Archduke Ferdinand and the subsequent outbreak of WWI. Mistrusted by his aristocratic peers because of his progressively democratic notions, Ferdinand seems destined to be martyred at the hands of his enemies, in much the same way that Rudolph was.

Credits: Producer, Eugene Tucherer ; director, Max Ophuls ; writers, Marcelle Maurette, Carl Zuckmayer, Jacques Natanson, Andre-Paul Antoine ; photography, Curt Alexandre, Curt Courant, Otto Heller ; music, Oscar Straus ; art direction, Jean d’Eaubonn
Cast: Edwige Feuillere, Gabrielle Doziat, John Lodge, Jacqueline Marsan, Aime Clariond, Monique Clariond, Jean Worms, Colette Regis, Jean Debucourt, Raymond Aimos, Henri Bosc.

results.title: De Duva = The Dove
results.creator_credit: George Coe, Anthony Lover, Sid Davis and Coe-Davis Ltd
results.brief_description: A broad travesty of Ingmar Bergman’s thematic and visual style based on ‘Wild Strawberries’, ‘Seventh Seal’ and ‘The Silence’. The dialogue is in Pidgin English spoken with a Swedish accent and dutifully translated by bland English subtitles. Cinematography and editing by Anthony Lover. Written by Sidney Davis. Cast includes David Zirlin, George Coe, Pamela Burrel, Peter Turgeon, Madeline Kahn, Tom Stone, Stan Rubinstein and Sidney Davis.

results.title: Our street was paved with gold
results.creator_credit: Albert Kish, David Bairstow and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A filmmaker revisits Montreal’s St. Lawrence Boulevard—the Main—the road from the docks to the heart of immigrant Canada. This is a little Europe, a street of many languages, many Old World foodstuffs, a hundred small courtesies that make the stranger feel at home. For the filmmaker his prevailing memory is of the seventeen steps of a walk-up apartment, but for all Canadians, born or made, this film has many nostalgic links with a common Canadian experience.

results.title: Our time in the garden
results.creator_credit: Susan Woll, Ron Blau and Central Studios
results.brief_description: Fifty-year old films from the home movies of the Blau family, Berlin Jews who lived in the Grunewald until 1933. Striking impressions of a happy life before the coming of Fascism. Made by Ron Blau. Voice of Gerda Blau.
